{{Wired embedded system |brand=Linksys |model=SPA2102 |asin=B000FKP55K;US; |manuf_country=China |is_manuf=No |manuf=Foxconn |manuf_model=U54V017 |type=router, analog phone gateway, VoIP phone adapter |pwr_v=5 |pwr_amp=1 |cpu1_brand=Sipura |cpu1_model=SIP316FF;SIP316FF, K469, TSVFQ1M857; |fla1=2 |fla1_brand=Macronix |fla1_model=29LV160C8TC-90G |ram1=8 |ram1_brand=ISSI |ram1_model=IC42S16400-7TG |eth_chip1_brand=Micrel |eth_chip1_model=SPN801024 |lan_speed=100M |lan_ports=1 |wan_ports=1 |addl_chips=Programmable CMOS SLIC/Codec with ringing/battery voltage generation; Silicon Labs; Si3215-FM;;2 |default_ip=192.168.0.1 |default_user=user & admin |default_pass= |oui_eth=00:0E:08 }} {{TagLine|Cisco SPA2102 Phone Adapter with Router}} :[http://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/unified-communications/spa2102-phone-adapter-router/model.html Product page]{{•}} [http://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/products/collateral/unified-communications/spa2102-phone-adapter-router/data_sheet_c78-502137.html Datasheet]
*[http://www.dslreports.com/forum/r27716637-Unlock-Unlocking-Linksys-SPA2102-adapter On '''DSLReports''' forums] (PCB images) <small> *The [[Linksys SPA2102]] is gateway router/analog telephony adapter (commonly referred to :as ATA) with two FXS ports, which allows for the connection of two “normal” telephones to :a VoIP provider using the Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) protocol. The product is based :on the SPA-2100, made by '''Sipura''' Technology, which was acquired by [[Cisco]] in 2005. *The ethernet chip is likely a custom version made for '''Sipura'''. The board picture :(see bellow) shows a ''Micrel SPN801024'' with lot number GFK7344.1M01. *Another picture [http://www.usbjtag.com/vbforum/attachment.php?s=8f37fccd51028ae31d7b3c66a615744f&attachmentid=382&d=1281192427 (found here)] shows a Micrel '''SPNZ801030''' whit lot number GFS7976.1. :Both lot numbers are close to GFK7343.1MEG and GFS7975.1MED found in the '''Micrel''' :MTBF report (see links & screenshot), which identify a '''KS8842''' chip. </small>
===Components=== :[http://www.zlgmcu.com/mxic/pdf/NOR_Flash_b/MX29LV160DTB_DS_EN.pdf MX29LV160DTB Datasheet] :[http://pdf.datasheetcatalog.com/datasheet/macronix/MX29LV160AT.pdf MX29LV160AT Datasheet] :[http://www.insidegadgets.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/07/IC42S16400.pdf IC42S16400 Datasheet] • [http://www.icsi.com.tw/index.html ISSI (Integrated Silicon Solution, Inc.)] :[http://www.silabs.com/Support%20Documents/TechnicalDocs/si3215.pdf Si3215 Datasheet] :[http://www.silabs.com/Support%20Documents/TechnicalDocs/si321xppqxevb.pdf Si321x Evaluation Board Documentation] :[http://www.micrel.com/index.php/zh/products/lan-solutions/switches.html Micrel Product Overview (Switches)] :[http://www.micrel.com/_PDF/qualrel/TSMC_.15.pdf Micrel MTBF Report / Lot Number list] :[http://www.micrel.com/_PDF/Ethernet/KS8842M_pb.pdf KS8842M Product Brief] :[http://www.micrel.com/_PDF/Ethernet/datasheets/KSZ8842MQL_DS.pdf KS8842M Datasheet] [http://reverse.0cpm.org/grandstream/datasheet/KSZ8842MQL.pdf (mirror)]
===Links=== :[http://www.cisco.com/c/dam/en/us/td/docs/voice_ip_comm/csbpvga/spa2102/quick_start/guide/spa2102_quick.pdf Quick Start Guide] :[http://www.cisco.com/en/US/docs/voice_ip_comm/csbpvga/ata/administration/guide/ATA_AG_v3_NC-WEB.pdf Aministration guide] :[http://www.connectdatasolutions.nl/wp-content/uploads/2013/02/Linksys-SPA2102-ATA-User-guide.pdf User Guide (babyTEL)] :[http://support.thinktel.ca/index.php/ajax/downloadFile/1d68c878-f8d5-11e1-bbab-000c290940b2/Provisioning%20Guide%20Linksys%20SPA.pdf Linksys SPA provisioning Guide] :[http://www.cisco.com/c/dam/en/us/td/docs/voice_ip_comm/csbpvga/spa2102/release/notes/spa2102_rn_v5-2-10.pdf Release notes v5.2.10] :[http://www.cisco.com/c/dam/en/us/td/docs/voice_ip_comm/csbpvga/spa2102/release/notes/spa2102_rn_v5-2-12.pdf Release notes v5.2.12] :[http://www.cisco.com/c/dam/en/us/td/docs/voice_ip_comm/csbpvga/spa2102/release/notes/spa2102_rn_v5-2-13.pdf Release notes v5.2.13] :[http://software.cisco.com/download/release.html?mdfid=282414111&flowid=5965&softwareid=282463187&release= Firmware v5.2.3 - v5.2.13] :[http://software.cisco.com/download/release.html?mdfid=282414111&flowid=5965&release=5.2.3&softwareid=282562500&sortparam= Profile Compiler (SPC) v5.2.3 - v5.2.13 Linux/Win32]
==Images== <gallery caption="external"> File:Linksys-SPA2102.jpg|Linksys SPA2102 File:Linksys-SPA2102-Top.jpg|Top View File:Linksys-SPA2102-Bottom.jpg|Bottom View File:Linksys-SPA2102-Front+Back-Side.jpg|Front & Back View </gallery>[[Has images::external| ]] <gallery caption="from [[User:Zerohero]]"> File:Linksys-SPA2102-Board-Top.jpg|Board Top Side File:Linksys-SPA2102-Board-Bottom.jpg|Board Bottom Side File:Micrel-TSMC_.15.png|Micrel lot numbers </gallery>[[Has images::internal| ]]
==See also== ===Sipura Technology Inc.=== * http://www.sipura.com :'''''[[Sipura]]''' - VoIP Hardware Solutions'' Sipura was purchased by [[Linksys]] and the ''Sipura'' product line has been rebranded to [[Linksys]]. :[[Linksys]] Voice products (what was ''Sipura'') are now going to be rebranded as [[Cisco]]. * http://www.voip-info.org/wiki/view/Sipura Makers of some of the most popular SIP ATAs available: *'''Sipura SPA1000''' - This ATA has now been superceded by the '''Sipura SPA-1001''' :1x FXS port *'''Sipura SPA1001''' :1x FXS port, 2x SIP lines *'''Sipura SPA2000''' - This ATA has now been superceded by the '''Sipura SPA-2002''' which is almost identical :2x FXS ports, VoIP *'''Sipura SPA2100''' Router/ATA :Router, 2x FXS ports, T.38 FAX support, QoS support *'''Sipura SPA3000''' - This ATA is discontinued and has been superceded by the [[Liksys SPA3102]] :1x FXS port, 1x FXO port, VoIP, SPA-841 VoIP phone, 2x to 4x line appearances, Speakerphone *'''SPA-941''' - VoIP phone :2-4x line appearances, Speakerphone, Wireless networking option
===[http://forum.voxilla.com/threads/whats-the-difference-between-the-spa-1001-pap2-pap2t-spa2102-and-spa3102.12576/ On '''VOXilla''' forums]=== Here's some info on the different Linksys adapters: *'''PAP2''' - has been discontinued and is replaced with the PAP2T. *'''PAP2T''' - the latest model 2 FXS adapter from Linksys. *'''SPA1001''' - has been discontinued and is replaced with the PAP2T. *'''SPA2102''' - the latest model 2 FXS, router, adapter from Linksys. *'''SPA3102''' - the latest model 1 FXO, 1 FXS, router, adapter from Linksys. :-NA or -EU means that the device is not associated with a particular VoIP provider (unlocked). Devices without -NA or -EU usually have another -XX designation and are locked to a specific VoIP Provider. :If you are looking to purchase used equipment, make sure it is a -NA or -EU model. Other models are not truely "unlocked" and will not be supported by Linksys or other prodivers.
===[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sipura_Technology On '''Wikipedia''']=== *'''SPA2000''': Basic phone adapter that allows two plain old telephone service (POTS) phones or fax machines :to be connected to an Ethernet network in order to make and receive telephone calls or faxes. *'''SPA2100''': Similar to the SPA2000 with the addition of an Ethernet router. Functions of the built-in router include QoS. *'''SPA3000''': The SPA3000 has one phone adapter port (FXS), one FXO port and can be used for POTS backup for strictly VoIP systems. *'''SPA3102''': Similar to the SPA3000, it includes a single LAN output that can be used to connect to a computer. :This is handy if the user only has an ISP modem and no router. The SPA3102 connects to the LAN socket on the ISP modem. :The computer, which is traditionally connected to the modem, now connects directly to the LAN connection on the SPA3102. :The SPA3102, effectively, is an ATA and single output router in one box. *'''SPA9000''': An IP PBX system that allows an auto-attendant to be configured, hunt groups, multiple IP phone extensions, and :POTS connectors. The SPA9000 also has basic router functions, port forwarding, quality of service, and DTMF functionality. *'''SPA901''': A basic IP phone with only one line. *'''SPA921''': A single-line phone with LCD screen. *'''SPA922''': A single-line phone with LCD screen, but adds a single port built in switch. *'''SPA941''': The flagship of the SPA phones, it incorporates a 4-line IP phone and an LCD. *'''SPA942''': Similar to the 941 aside from the additions of power over Ethernet ability, back-lit screen, and a single port built-in switch. *'''SPA962''': Similar in appearance and functionality to the 941/942, it features a six line, 2-inch color screen
__NOTOC__
